column1: Jordan was watching a movie.

column3: One day she noticed she was starting to itch.
column4: She decided to go to the doctor about it.
column5: Come to find out, Katie had a peanut allergy.

column1: Carl was at a family reunion.
column2: He ran into a stranger.
column3: It turned out to be a long lost cousin.
column4: They got along well and became friends.
column5: They still keep in touch.

column1: Ethel always loved her grandmother's peach cobbler.
column2: That was the one thing she missed when she went away to school.
column3: One day, she called her grandmother for the recipe.
column4: She went to the store off campus and bought the supplies.
column5: Her peach cobbler tasted nothing like her grandmother's.

column1: Billy always complained about his shoe laces.
column2: He hated them coming untied in the bathroom.
column3: When he tied his shoes he would think of all those germs.
column4: Yesterday he showed up to work with velcro shoes.
column5: I seemed very happy even though everyone laughed at him.

column1: Marvin and Mary are married.
column2: They both got sick at the same time.
column3: I asked what I could do to help them.
column4: They asked me to make them chicken soup.
column5: I made the chicken soup and they are feeling better now.

column1: Jared has been training for the Olympics since he was 14 years old.
column2: He made it to the 2016 Olympics in Brazil.
column3: On the day of his events, he was extremely nervous.
column4: He lost three events but placed second in two others.
column5: He returned home very thankful with two silver medals.

column1: Today I drove to the coffee shop.
column2: On my way, I saw three deer.
column3: The deer were eating in a field.
column4: When I got to the coffee shop, I told my friend about them.
column5: He suggested that we drive back to see them, so we did.

column1: James challenged John to game of basketball.
column2: James shot the ball thinking he'd make it.
column3: But John blocked it with malice.
column4: John took his shot and made it with a grin.
column5: James walked home sadly.

column1: After high school, she went to college.
column2: She enrolled in the community college.
column3: She started attending every week day.
column4: She wanted to major in Journalism.
column5: She dropped out after the 2nd semester.

column1: Cleo was visiting his friend out of state.
column2: Cleo drove five hours to get to his friend's home.
column3: The two friends had dinner and reminisced about old times.
column4: They spent the week seeing the sites of the city.
column5: At the end of the week, Cleo drove home.

column1: Joy was decorating her porch.
column2: She got a basket and put some mums in it.
column3: She tried to move the basket, but the handle popped off.
column4: The basket completely fell apart.
column5: Joy was so frustrated!

column1: Someone called Diana in the middle of the night.
column2: She declined the call since an unknown number called.
column3: A few minutes later, there was an aggressive knock on the door.
column4: She went outside to open it.
column5: No one stood in front of the door, but the phone rang again.

column1: The man lost his shoes.
column2: His wife wanted to know how.
column3: He could not remember.
column4: She called his friend.
column5: His friend said that he gave them away at the bar.

column1: Laura adored a lot of celebrities and wanted to meet one!

column3: She tried to meet one while downtown the next day.
column4: There was a popular play going on so she went there.
column5: After the play she waited around and ended up meeting one!

column1: Jane was driving home from work.
column2: She got a flat tire.
column3: A police officer noticed.
column4: He offered to change her tire.

column1: Sam and Nancy had been dating for many months.
column2: Sam wanted to take the relationship further, in an intimate direction.
column3: Nancy convinced him she loved him.
column4: Sam worked over-time for weeks to buy the ring.

column1: Melissa hated eggplants a lot.
column2: She didn't like them because they were purple.
column3: One day, she was forced to eat one.
column4: At first, she declined.
column5: But after tasting one, Melissa fell in love with eggplants.

column1: It was the first cold day of the winter.
column2: Jane wore her glasses on her walk to school.
column3: When she entered the building they fogged over.
column4: She had no idea that would happen.
column5: She laughed as she cleaned the fog off with her shirt.

column1: Colby had a dream to build his own treehouse.

column3: He called his friends to come help him build it.
column4: They made ladders and slides to go in and out of it.
column5: The treehouse became a great place to play.

column1: Ed had finally gotten an interview for his dream job.

column3: He felt confident the day of the interview.
column4: When he met the woman he was interviewing with, he knew it was bad.
column5: It was a woman he had dumped three years ago after a few dates.

column1: Olivia was getting ready for a fancy party.
column2: She was debating wearing her favorite necklace with her.
column3: Suddenly the necklace broke at the clasp.
column4: Olivia tried to fix it but it was inexplicably ruined.
column5: She threw it out and decided to buy a new one.

column1: Ross bought a refurbished coffee maker online.
column2: When it arrived in the mail he went to test out the unit.
column3: The coffee maker made a gurgling noise and did not work.
column4: Ross was furious and called up the store that sold him the unit.
column5: Ross got a full refund and didn't have to ship out the broken unit.

column1: I returned home with groceries one day after shopping.
column2: I carried my groceries into the house and put them on the counter.
column3: I opened my fridge, and noticed there was no room for my groceries.
column4: I began to clean out my fridge and put away my new items.
column5: After cleaning out the fridge, I had to take my trash out to the can.

column1: When Ann met John, he made a poor impression.
column2: John barely spoke to her or even look at her.
column3: Ann concluded that John was arrogant and rude.
column4: John wrote Ann a letter, explaining she made him feel nervous.
column5: Ann was surprised to learn that John was actually smitten with her!

column1: My cat is always hungry and begging for food.
column2: The other day she jumped upon me while I was sleeping.
column3: She dabbed her wet nose to mine.
column4: When I opened my eyes she started to purr.
column5: I went and filled up her food bowl.

column1: Davis had his backpack ready to go.
column2: He was going for a hike and camping trip.
column3: He arrived at the trail and began hiking.
column4: Davis walked for many miles, found a camp, and set it up.
column5: He had a wonderful time that weekend, hiking and camping.

column3: One day he woke up sitting beside Sleeping Beauty.
column4: When he leaned to kiss her, Ezekiel sneezed.

column1: I bought a jar of dip yesterday.
column2: I couldn't open it.
column3: I was very frustrated.
column4: I tried everything.
column5: Finally I got it open with a spoon.

column1: Suzanne tried out for tennis one day.
column2: She ended up being one of the best out of everyone who tried out.
column3: She made it on the team!
column4: Suzanne was ecstatic.
column5: Her parents were very proud of her.

column1: One day I was walking down an alleyway.
column2: I saw a cardboard box that I look inside.

column4: I picked him up to take him home.
column5: He is my new best friend.

column1: Don wanted to stop by the hardware store on Wednesday.
column2: He got out of work at 4 PM.
column3: He knew the store closed at 5.
column4: He boarded a bus bound for the hardware store.
column5: He arrived with twenty minutes to spare, but the store closed early.

column1: Kristin took a trip.
column2: She stayed on the beach for a week.
column3: She had never seen the ocean before!
column4: Kristin walked in the sand and watched the sun set.
column5: She felt completely at peace.

column1: One day, Billy saw a magician at a birthday party.
column2: Billy was enamored by the magic tricks that the magician performed.
column3: Billy was shocked when on his birthday his dad gave him a magic set.
column4: He quickly taught himself all the tricks and showed his friends.
column5: Billy eventually found the magician and blew him away with his skills.

column1: Bud got a skateboard for Christmas.
column2: He hung around the skate park, but the other kids wouldn't teach him.
column3: He sat on his board, watching their moves, slowly learning.
column4: He went and practiced early in the morning while the park was empty.
column5: When he became a professional skater, he laughed about those old days.

column1: Michael was stunned to learn he had HIV.
column2: He knows it is not a death sentence but was still very upset.
column3: He was mainly worried about all of the people he had sex with.
column4: They would all need to be told and get tested.
column5: He didn't deceive anyone but still felt horrible for it anyway.

column1: Mazey lurched forward as the ostrich tried to insert its beak inside.

column3: Mazey was afraid and told the guide to drive on ahead.
column4: The guide told her they were going to leave the car instead.
column5: Mazey panicked when exiting the car and ran as the ostriches chased.

column1: Mary stopped at a stop sign on her way home from work.
column2: She witnessed someone run through the stop sign and get pulled over.
column3: The cop gave the person a ticket.
column4: Mary decided to be more cautious so she wouldn't miss any stop signs.
column5: She didn't miss any on the rest of the drive home.

column1: Sterling wanted to build a wall made of beer bottles.
column2: He thought it would impress the ladies that came into his dorm room.
column3: Sterling started collecting every bottle he could find.
column4: As he started to stack the bottles against the wall they fell.
column5: Sterling's room smells like old beer and everyone thinks it stinks.

column1: Holmberg hosted a radio show every day.

column3: However, not many people listened to his show.
column4: Holmberg was running out of money!
column5: Holmberg was forced to shut down his radio show and get a job.

column1: I went on a guided nature hike in Estonia.

column4: She asked us to put our arms around a tree and listen to it.
column5: She literally wanted us to be tree huggers!

column1: Lenny was baking cookies.

column5: And he felt better that his cookies had some use.

column1: It was halloween and Gary and his friends were happy.

column3: Gary and his friends spend hours popping out of bushes.
column4: When Gary tried to scare one child, the kid kicked him in the shins.
column5: Gary feel to the floor in a lot of pain and could barely walk.

column1: My car broke down on the highway.

column5: Once it's done I will be off and driving again.

column4: The fire of their lust was no match for the cold iceberg the ship met.

column1: My son came home from school wanting to play a new game on his Ipod.

column5: He said he had already scheduled, and paid for, couples counseling!

column1: Fred was waiting for the bus outside.

column1: Winston always wanted to be  a cop.

column3: He worked very hard.

column1: I signed up for online tutoring in Korean.

column1: I watched a basketball game.

column1: Mike couldn't wait to play baseball like his big brother.

column3: Many used items, including clothing and food, were up for sale.
column4: I found a good deal on a pair of Nikes and decided to buy them.
column5: My cousin and I came home with several things.

column1: Tom was on a road trip to Texas.
column2: He passed by many drivers on the road.
column3: One driver didn't like him trying to pass him.
column4: The other driver nearly crashed into Tom.
column5: Tom avoided the driver and safely made it to Texas.

column1: Jessica wanted to do something big for her 30th birthday.

column3: She talked to some of her friends and they all agreed to go.
column4: Jessica bought the tickets and met up with her friends.
column5: They all went skydiving and had a great time.

column1: Paul purchased a book from the bookstore.
column2: He opened it to see if he had the right book.
column3: However, it turned out to be the book.
column4: He went to return it.
column5: The offer he got for returning it was bad since he already opened it.

column1: Ed saw a fight in the school cafeteria.

column3: Ed wanted to stop the fight, not take photos.
column4: Ed went in between the two students.
column5: He pushed them aside and stopped the fight.

column1: The bridge was new and very costly.
column2: It had taken years to build.
column3: Traffic had been detoured from the interstate.
column4: Finally, the road was reopened.
column5: The bridge developed a huge crack and the road was closed.

column1: Izzy went to an exotic restaurant he'd never visited before.
column2: He ordered an ethnic sounding dish from the menu.
column3: He didn't know what it was but enjoyed it a lot.
column4: The waiter told him it was the intimate parts of a tiger.
column5: Izzy retches every time someone reminds him of this experience.

column1: Kent was angry.

column3: He decided to send them a text and tell them how he felt.
column4: He texted a horrible message to all of them.
column5: They texted back that they had invited him and he had never responded.

column1: Kelly was a very outgoing person.
column2: She then moved to a new area.
column3: She was very unfamiliar with this area and this made her nervous.
column4: She tried really hard to make new friends.
column5: Eventually, she met a new group of people and moved on with her life.

column1: The smith's wanted to get away.
column2: They decided to travel to the Bahama's.
column3: The family had the best time swimming and surfing.
column4: They had the time of their lives.
column5: The smith family decided the Bahama's would be their tradition.

column1: Harry was being sued for defamation.
column2: He was confident he would win so he didn't hire a lawyer.
column3: He lost the case.
column4: He was ordered to pay the plaintiff.
column5: Harry realized he should have hired a lawyer.

column1: Jim and Martha knew buying a house was hard.
column2: But they did not think it was that hard!
column3: Little did they know there were a lot of steps to be taken.
column4: Once everything was finalized they could buy a house.
column5: They were very happen when they signed the last paper.

column1: My father bought me a shetland pony for my fifth birthday.

column3: I was very excited when I climbed into my new pink saddle!
column4: As soon as I settled in, she began to kick her back legs wildly!

column1: When I was in elementary school, my uncle lent me a book.
column2: It was the first Harry Potter book.
column3: I read it and demanded the next one.
column4: Soon I had finished all he had.
column5: I went with him to buy the last one at midnight.

column1: Carol is getting married.
column2: She always wanted to have a big wedding.
column3: She planned a big reception party.
column4: She is happy that her dreams came true.
column5: All of her friends and family are coming.

column1: Jordan was having a perfectly pleasant day at the beach.
column2: He was enjoying a chocolate ice cream cone.
column3: Then all of the sudden a seagull flew towards Jordan out of nowhere.
column4: The seagull grabbed Jordan's ice cream cone right out of his hand.
column5: The seagull incident really but a damper on Jordan's beach day.

column1: Every Friday night me and my friends play basketball.
column2: Last Friday we went to the local gym to play ball.
column3: A lot of new people showed up who I didn't know.
column4: I got to know them while we were playing.
column5: Now I have a lot of new friends to play basketball with!

column1: Mark was friends with a blacksmith.

column3: When Mark filled a garbage can with scrap he called the friend.
column4: The friend came over and took the can of metal.
column5: He made mark a metal sculpture as a thank you gesture.

column1: The day was finally here.
column2: John was nervous.
column3: He was going to ask his girlfriend to marry him.
column4: He got down on one knee.
column5: She said yes!

column1: Susie was having a costume party.
column2: She invited all of her friends.
column3: She dressed up as a cat.
column4: Her friends loved it.
column5: Susie ended up winning the costume contest at the party.

column1: Amy's parents wanted to know where she had been.
column2: She pulled a candy bar from her pocket.
column3: They believed she had been at the store.
column4: They never knew she was at the park with a boy they disliked.

column1: Ralph's doctor told him his weight was high and it was unhealthy.

column3: He didn't go far, but he tried again the next day and went farther.
column4: After a month he hadn't skipped a day of jogging.
column5: He finally weighed himself and found out that he lost fifteen pounds.

column2: He feels a lot of pressure to be skinny.
column3: One day he tried throwing up after eating.
column4: It did not make him feel good.
column5: Melvin doesn't want to throw up again to be skinny.

column1: Gary left the bar one night after hanging out with friends.
column2: He got into his car and began to drive.
column3: After a minute, Gary suddenly began to fall asleep behind the wheel.
column4: Gary forced himself to stay awake until he made it home.
column5: When he made it home, Gary collapsed on his couch.

column2: They would practice in their garages.
column3: One day, a neighbor called to complain.

column5: The band decided to take up poetry reciting instead.

column1: Betty got detention.
column2: She snuck out of detention.
column3: Her teacher caught her sneaking out.
column4: She gave her twice as much detention.
column5: Betty finished her detention.

column1: Gina and her friends were at the school library.

column3: But Gina couldn't find any.
column4: She returned to the table where her friends were sitting.

column2: The weather was beginning to warm up in the spring.

column5: It took weeks to get the flooding under control.

column1: The woman talked to her cat.
column2: The cat stared at the woman.

column4: The woman thought the cat was answering her.
column5: She started talking with the cat all the time.

column1: Joseph has always wanted a dog since he was little.

column3: He was able to play with Rover, their shepherd, on a daily basis.
column4: Joseph was upset that he couldn't take Rover home with him.
column5: But as the summer ends, Joseph knew next year would return.

column1: Tim was playing ball.
column2: He threw it on the roof.
column3: He started crying.
column4: His dad saw what happened.
column5: His dad got the ball so Tim would stop crying.

column3: It drove the boy who sat next to her crazy.

column2: She could not find her can opener.
column3: Sara tried using a hammer instead.
column4: She smacked the can with the hammer to no avail.

column1: Tom had the day off from work.

column4: Tom decided to spend the day cleaning instead.
column5: He was a bit tired but felt accomplished.

column1: Todd and his friends gathered after school.

column1: His mother was very unhappy.

column3: She tried to warn her off.
column4: She told her that her son was taking advantage of her.
column5: She said he was going to hurt her, but she wouldn't listen.

column1: Calvin had just bought a new video game.

column5: By the end of the day, he had beaten every level.

column1: Jenny knew that the midterm was only a week away.

column4: The day of the big test came.

column1: The boy asked a question.

column4: He found the answer.
column5: He told everybody the answer to the question.

column1: Kelley went to a nice store.

column1: I am a strong advocate of environmental preservation.

column1: My girlfriend always hogs the bed sheets when we sleep.

column1: There was a man in the alley named Bill

column1: The man went into the basement.

column1: Susan loves singing.

column4: She wanted to work things out.
column5: He left her for another woman.

column1: Sally wanted a horse for her birthday.
column2: Her parents told her no.
column3: Sally was very upset.
column4: She cried up until the day of her birthday.
column5: Her parents had tricked her though and she woke up with a pet pony.

column1: Georgina was newly pregnant.
column2: She was going in for her first ultrasound.
column3: The results revealed that Georgina was actually pregnant for awhile.
column4: This new dating changed everything about her pregnancy.
column5: Georgina was just happy to be even closer to meeting her baby.

column1: Alex became a salesman at a young age.
column2: Electronics were his specialty, despite his lack of experience.
column3: His ability to spout facts and figures impressed customers.
column4: Given a promotion, he managed inventory based on this alone.
column5: His skill as a master manipulator helped him save face many times.

column1: Nate was a smoker.
column2: He smoked inside with his children.
column3: One of his children developed a chronic cough.
column4: Nate decided to start smoking outside.
column5: Nate's son cough went away.

column1: Katherine enjoyed berets a lot.
column2: She loved wearing them as an accessory.
column3: One day, she realized she didn't have any more berets.
column4: Katherine immediately rushed to the store.
column5: Now, Katherine has a lot of berets.

column1: Lizzy was watching monkeys at the zoo.
column2: One kept staring at her.
column3: She scratched her head.
column4: He scratched his head, too.
column5: She realized he was a copy cat monkey!

column1: Ian was studying for an exam.
column2: He forgot the material he was supposed for.
column3: The next day, the teacher announced what the exam covered.
column4: He also passed the exam packet.
column5: Ian became nervous since he studied the wrong material.

column1: Babs was a rare breed of tiger.
column2: Babs was the last of her kind.
column3: With no male tigers around, Babs might die without producing a cub.
column4: A male was recently found in the wild.
column5: The male tiger and Babs could now produce offspring.

column1: The sun came out around noon.
column2: Mostly everyone on campus stayed indoors since outside was hot.
column3: I had to walk outside since my class was on the other side of school.
column4: I started to sweat all over my entire body while walking.
column5: Before going to class, I went to the bathroom to wash my face.

column1: Sue was going through the drive thru.
column2: She placed her order for coffee.
column3: She went to pay and was told it had already been paid for.
column4: She was shocked about the kindness.
column5: She then decided to leave money for someone else's order too.

column1: George locked the door to his apartment.
column2: He was convinced someone was following him.
column3: He heard a knock on his door.
column4: George peered through the peep hole.
column5: It was two Jehovah's Witnesses preaching the gospel.

column1: Sally was the manager of a restaurant.
column2: She had not been meeting the expectations of her job.
column3: She was careless in her work.
column4: Her boss fired her for talking on her phone too much.
column5: Sally filed for unemployment at her local government office after.

column1: It was the first recital for Kate's ballet class.
column2: She had practiced a lot.
column3: But she hadn't gotten any better.
column4: At the recital she wasn't very good.
column5: But it didn't matter because she enjoyed herself.

column1: Sue is unable to drive a car.
column2: Instead, she rides the bus.
column3: One day, someone on the bus sat on her.
column4: This made her very unhappy.
column5: Sue decided to carpool with her friend to work moving forward.

column1: Doug thought a scary movie would make a great first date.
column2: He pictured his date jumping into his arms out of fright.
column3: Doug chose a new slasher film for the big night.
column4: When a gory scene came on screen, the date threw up in Doug's lab.
column5: They left the theater and Doug drove the girl straight home.
